thread.section_title: The Columbus Dispatch High School Sports Feed
thread.title: High school football roundup: Hartley's Hickman, defense down Watterson
thread.title_full: High school football roundup: Hartley's Hickman, defense down Watterson | The Columbus Dispatch

author: The Columbus Dispatch
title: High school football roundup: Hartley's Hickman, defense down Watterson
text:
Hartley 10, Watterson 0:   Quri Hickman had 26 carries for 184 yards and one TD, and Hartley (5-3) shut out host Watterson (4-4) in nonleague action. Hickman scored on a 36-yard run in the fourth quarter. Ben Hawk had Hartleyâ€™s other score with a 20-yard field goal. Hartley held the Eagles to 113 total yards and had two interceptions.  

DeSales 44, Logan 7:   Alonzo Booth had 171 yards rushing and two first-quarter touchdowns, Jake Gilmore added 69 yards and two scores and DeSales (7-1) routed visiting Logan (6-2) in a nonleague game. 

La Salle 42, St. Charles 20:  Otis Smith scored on a 10-yard run in the first quarter for St. Charles before Cincinnati LaSalle (7-1) scored 42 unanswered points to beat the visiting Cardinals (3-5) in nonleague action. Smith also had a 4-yard touchdown run in the fourth quarter and Greg Scarpitti returned a fumble 69 yards for a score.  

Highland 49, Fredericktown 14:   Dakota Bunting had 167 yards rushing and a touchdown, Jared Limings had 148 and three touchdowns and Highland (5-3, 5-0) took over sole possession of first place in the Mid-Ohio Athletic Conference Blue Division with a win over visiting Fredericktown (6-2, 4-1). 

Jonathan Alder 35, North Union 14:   Jonathan Alder (7-1, 5-0) maintained a one-game lead in the Mid-Ohio Athletic Conference, overcoming an early deficit to beat host North Union (4-4, 2-3). Sean Sullivan had 151 yards rushing and sealed the win with a 5-yard touchdown run in the fourth quarter. Tim Gilliland and Luke Krawczyk each caught a touchdown pass to give North Union a 14-0 lead in the second quarter. Trey Pugh tied the score at 14 with a 23-yard catch in the second quarter and an 18-yard run in the third. 

Heath 31, Northridge 0:   Aaron Latiolais accounted for four touchdowns and host Heath (5-3, 1-2) shut out Northridge (4-4, 0-2) in the LCL Cardinal Division. Latiolais rushed for 174 yards and two touchdowns and also threw two TD passes.
